actions.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights

official_title: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to provide that any officer of the United States shall forfeit office and all benefits thereof upon conviction of a felony.

summary.text: Constitutional Amendment - States that any officer of the United States appointed by the President with the advice and consent of the Senate shall upon conviction of a felony and exhaustion of all appeals forfeit office and all prerogatives, benefits, or compensation thereof.

titles.title: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to provide that any officer of the United States shall forfeit office and all benefits thereof upon conviction of a felony.
